channel.title: Transporter on COTTON
channel.description: Recent content in Transporter on COTTON

item.title: GhCBL2
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gh_A01G0740 Gene Symbol: GhCBL2 Gene Name: Genome: TM-1 reference genome Species: Gossypium hirsutum Functional Descriptions: Overexpression of either GhCBL2, GhCIPK6, or GhTST2 was sufficient to promote sugar accumulation in transgenic cotton, whereas RNAi-mediated knockdown of GhCIPK6 expression or CRISPR-Cas9-mediated knockout of GhTST2 resulted in significantly decreased Glc content.

item.title: GhCIPK6
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gh_D06G1020 Gene Symbol: GhCIPK6 Gene Name: Genome: TM-1 reference genome Species: Gossypium hirsutum Functional Descriptions: Overexpression of either GhCBL2, GhCIPK6, or GhTST2 was sufficient to promote sugar accumulation in transgenic cotton, whereas RNAi-mediated knockdown of GhCIPK6 expression or CRISPR-Cas9-mediated knockout of GhTST2 resulted in significantly decreased Glc content.

item.title: GhHAK5aA
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gh_A01G1516 Gene Symbol: GhHAK5aA Gene Name: Genome: Species: Gossypium hirsutum Functional Descriptions: The Cotton High-Affinity K+ Transporter, GhHAK5a, Is Essential for Shoot Regulation of K+ Uptake in Root under Potassium Deficiency.

item.title: GhSWEET12
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gorai.005G195100 Gene Symbol: GhSWEET12 Gene Name: Genome: Species: Gossypium hirsutum Functional Descriptions: RNA-seq and proteinâˆ’DNA binding assays revealed that GhMYB212 was closely linked to the pathways of sucrose and starch transportation and metabolism, directly controling the expression of a sucrose transporter gene GhSWEET12.

item.title: GhTST2
item.description: Gene Details: Gene ID: Gh_D01G0848 Gene Symbol: GhTST2 Gene Name: Genome: TM-1 reference genome Species: Gossypium hirsutum Functional Descriptions: Overexpression of either GhCBL2, GhCIPK6, or GhTST2 was sufficient to promote sugar accumulation in transgenic cotton, whereas RNAi-mediated knockdown of GhCIPK6 expression or CRISPR-Cas9-mediated knockout of GhTST2 resulted in significantly decreased Glc content.
